name: drngui
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

body.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(cui, c2))
-| wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(cui, c2))
-| wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))

stmt.origin: simpri(wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1))), wcel(c2, crg))

body.origin:
|- wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))
-| wa(wcel(c2, crg), wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(cui, c2))
-| wa(wcel(c2, crg), wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1))))

stmt.origin: mpbi(wa(wcel(c2, crg), wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))), wcel(c2, cdr))
stmt.pretty: mpbi((c2 ∈ Ring ∧(Unit ` c2)=(c0 \ { c1 })), c2 ∈ DivRing)

body.origin:
|- wa(wcel(c2, crg), wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1))))
-| wcel(c2, cdr)
-| wb(wcel(c2, cdr), wa(wcel(c2, crg), wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c2 ∈ Ring ∧(Unit ` c2)=(c0 \ { c1 }))
⊣ c2 ∈ DivRing
⊣ (c2 ∈ DivRing ↔(c2 ∈ Ring ∧(Unit ` c2)=(c0 \ { c1 })))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(cui, c2))
-| wcel(c2, cdr)
-| wb(wcel(c2, cdr), wa(wcel(c2, crg), wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 \ { c1 })=(Unit ` c2)
⊣ c2 ∈ DivRing
⊣ (c2 ∈ DivRing ↔(c2 ∈ Ring ∧(Unit ` c2)=(c0 \ { c1 })))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c2, cdr), wa(wcel(c2, crg), wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cdif(c0, csn(c1)))))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c2))
-| wceq(cfv(cui, c2), cfv(cui, c2))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c2 ∈ DivRing ↔(c2 ∈ Ring ∧(Unit ` c2)=(c0 \ { c1 })))
⊣ c0 =(Base ` c2)
⊣ (Unit ` c2)=(Unit ` c2)
⊣ c1 =(0 ` c2)

-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c2))

⊣ c2 ∈ DivRing
⊣ c0 =(Base ` c2)

comment: The set of units of a division ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)
